dd.p: System updates execution status of the test suite after the delay period (in seconds) specified.
Number of times running test cases in the test suite.

This option is supported in version 7.6 onwards. Specify which execution to be retried (this parameter overrides setting in test suite file):
allExecutions: Retry all executions when the Test Suite fails
failedExecutions: Retry only failed executions when the Test Suite fails
immediately: Retry a failed execution of a test case or test data immediately. (Only for Katalon Studio Enterprise users)

ul.li: From version 8.1.0, you can terminate a test suite/ test suite collection execution based on the number of test failures.
Set <T> as the maximum number of total test failures allowed in the execution. Reaching <T> terminates the test execution.
A test failure is counted when any of these type of tests fails: test case, retried test case, test iteration, or retried test iteration.

dd.p: Specify the destination folder for saving report files. You can use an absolute path or relative path (root being project folder).
Specify the name for report files (.html, .csv, .log). If not provided, the system uses the name "report" (report.html, report.csv, report.log). .

li.p: -reportFileName is only interpreted if -reportFolder is specified.

dlentry.dd: Specify the e-mail address for receiving report files. If the e-mail address was not specified, the report files are not to be sent.

dd.p: Specify the remote web driver URL.

Specify the server URL that you use to activate a KRE license. From Katalon Studio version 8.3.5 onwards, you can use this parameter to activate a KRE license with Private Instance while executing in console mode. For example: -serverUrl="https://admin-tenant1.katalon-cloudops.com".
Remote web's driver type.

li.p: remoteWebDriverType is only interpreted if remoteWebDriverUrl is specified.

dt.codeph: -deviceId=<device Id for Android/device UUID for ios>

dd.p: Specify the device's ID to execute test scripts using this device.

ul.li: -deviceId is only interpreted if -browserType is specified.

dd.p: Specify the execution profile that a test suite executes with
From version 7.6.0 onwards, you can use this option in Test Suite Collection execution. The specified execution profile is applied to all test suites in that collection.

ul.li: From Katalon version 8.2.0 onwards, you can set a delay between each test suite execution in a Test Suite Collection.
Value is a positive integer from 0-999 seconds.
When a test suite is ready to start, KRE prints a message in Console Log: Test suite ${testSuiteID} is ready to start at ${currentTimeStamp}

dd.p: Override Execution Profile variables.
Example:-g_userName="admin"
From version 7.8.0, you can override the search query of the dynamic test suite from the CLI.

<search-query> is the search condition that follows the query syntax of the installed query provider plugin. For detailed instruction, follow this guide: Pass the search query to the CLI for dynamic test suite execution.
Example:-testSuiteQuery="ids=(Test Cases/TC1_Verify Successful Login,Test Cases/TC2_Verify Successful Appointment)"
From version 8.0.0, you can enable or disable Test Suite(s) in Test Suite Collection.
Example:-testSuiteCollectionQuery="indexes=(1,3)"
Override the maximum response size in project setting (available from version 7.6). Learn more about Web Service Settings.
Example:-maxResponseSize=400
From version 8.0.0, you can release the previous execution session before checking the license.
Example:

dlentry.dd: Allow WebDriver binaries to be updated automatically in console mode.
